column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it. A work friend, who didn't hear what the person wanted, changes the oat milk in the jar with almond milk while Noor is doing something else. Noor makes the coffee with the milk in the jar.
column2: Does Noor think the milk jar has oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk.
column4: Noor thinks the milk jar has almond milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully. A gallery staff member, realizing there was a mix-up, changes the label with the correct information attributing the painting to an emerging artist instead. Zara looks for more information about the famous artist.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night. At night, a big rain makes the river too full, opens the water door and puts too much water in the corn field. Carlos phones his friend to ask if they can open the water door.
column2: Does Carlos think the water door is closed or open?
column3: Carlos thinks the water door is still closed.
column4: Carlos thinks the water door is already open.

column1: Harry is in his home on a cold day. Harry wants to make his home warm with a fire in the fireplace. Harry sees the fireplace is full of wood ready for a fire. But, a chubby cat, looking for a warm place, jumps into the fireplace and pushes out all the wood. Harry plans to light the fire in the fireplace.
column2: Does Harry think the fireplace is ready for a fire or does he think a cat is in the fireplace?
column3: Harry thinks the fireplace is ready for a fire.
column4: Harry thinks a cat is in the fireplace.

column1: Emily is on a popular island for a fun day. Emily wants to tie her boat to a big tree near the beach. Emily sees the tree is strong and big. Suddenly, a strong wind blows and breaks the big tree. Emily starts to tie her boat to the tree.
column2: Does Emily think the tree is strong or broken?
column3: Emily thinks the tree is strong.
column4: Emily thinks the tree is broken.

column1: Lisa is at a big party with her friends. Lisa wants to play a song on her violin for her friends. Lisa's violin is in a clean and shiny case. But while Lisa is away, a little boy opens the violin case and spills his juice on the violin. Lisa opens the case and starts to play her violin.
column2: Does Lisa think her violin is clean or has juice on it?
column3: Lisa thinks her violin is clean.
column4: Lisa thinks her violin has juice on it.

column1: Billy is playing in his room with his toy cars. Billy wants to play a game where his toy gun is the start line for the cars. Billy's toy gun is standing up straight on the floor. A gust of wind from an open window knocks the toy gun over. Billy sits down on the floor and starts the car race.
column2: Does Billy believe his toy gun is standing up or has fallen over?
column3: Billy believes his toy gun is standing up.
column4: Billy believes his toy gun has fallen over.

column1: Gina is in her garden with her white ball. Gina wants to play catch with her dog. Gina's ball is clean and white. But, a naughty squirrel takes the ball, rolls it in the mud, and makes it dirty. Gina plans to throw the ball for her dog to catch.
column2: Does Gina think the ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Gina thinks the ball is clean.
column4: Gina thinks the ball is dirty.

column1: Dino is at a big party with his friends. Dino wants to share a big, thin cake with his friends. The cake is on a high table. Suddenly, a small dog jumps on the table and eats the cake. Dino takes the cake from the table to share with his friends.
column2: Does Dino think the cake is on the table or has the dog eaten it?
column3: Dino thinks the cake is still on the table.
column4: Dino thinks the dog has eaten the cake.

column1: Wanda is in her room with her big book. Wanda wants to put a pretty stamp on a page to mark her favorite story. Wanda's stamp is new and sticky. Suddenly, her little brother, who is playing around, spills water on the stamp and it's no longer sticky. Wanda plans to put the stamp on her book page.
column2: Does Wanda think the stamp is sticky or wet?
column3: Wanda thinks the stamp is still sticky.
column4: Wanda thinks the stamp is wet.

column1: Felix is at a big car race. Felix wants to unlock his race car and start the motor to join the race. Felix sees that his car keys are in his pocket. While Felix is talking to a friend, a gust of wind blows the car keys out of his pocket onto the ground. Felix takes the keys out of his pocket to unlock his car.
column2: Does Felix think his car keys are in his pocket or on the ground?
column3: Felix thinks his car keys are in his pocket.
column4: Felix thinks his car keys are on the ground.

column1: Violet is in a beautiful garden full of flowers. Violet wants to take a picture of a big red rose. The rose is in full bloom and it looks very pretty. Suddenly, a naughty squirrel comes and nibbles the petals off the rose. Violet takes a picture of the blooming rose.
column2: Does Violet think the rose is in full bloom or has the squirrel nibbled the petals off?
column3: Violet thinks the rose is still in full bloom.
column4: Violet thinks the squirrel has nibbled the petals off the rose.
